de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing

Class LoginDialogue

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.control.Dialog<LoginCredentials>
      • de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing.LoginDialogue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class LoginDialogue
extends javafx.scene.control.Dialog<LoginCredentials>

    A simple dialogue that prompts the user for their username and password. If both are given, it converts them into a LoginCredentials object. By appropriately disabling its loginButton, it will prevent invalid input, such as empty or null Strings.

    This class is heavily inspired by a sample provided by Marco Jakob on his website with only a few adjustments to it.

    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginDialogue

        public LoginDialogue(java.lang.String givenName)
        Constructor for the LoginDialogue class. In case a username is already known to the application (e.g. from the command line or from a previous login attempt), it may be passed to the constructor and automatically be injected into the username field.
        Parameters:
        givenName - a username for convenience. May be empty or null.
